intro: Chamaesyce atoto, commonly known as the Mexican dwarf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in spring, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Chamaesyce atoto is often used in landscaping for its low maintenance and ornamental value.
